data.title: PropertyEditor cuts of decimal number
data.body:
The property editor in dualty only shows three decimal places when you enter a small decimal number.

For example:
0.1  -> displays: 0.1
0.001 -> displays: 0.00 -> :-1: 

Is this a bug?

data.title: Consider Making HelpInfo a Struct

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
#### Summary

The `HelpInfo` class is used by the help system to encapsulate the currently displayed piece of Advisor information. In many places, it will be generated on-the-fly for each input event, causing a large amount of garbage, which could be avoided by making `HelpInfo` a struct.
#### Analysis
- This hasn't been an actual issue so far. It's more of a best-practices consideration.
- Determine whether `HelpInfo` is small enough to be viable as a struct.
  - It currently is, but will it be long-term?
- Check if there is a reason why HelpInfo would ever use inheritance.
- Check the amount of potential garbage generated by the Create methods.
- Alternatively, introduce an easy-to-use caching mechanism that would allow `IHelpProvider` implementations to return the same instance easily, without the need to cache it locally.
  - Could be some kind of an "hasn't changed since last time" thing.

data.title: Advanced option in Package Manager to add more repositories

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
In the package manager, when you click the `Advanced` button, a context menu pops up. There should be an option to add custom repositories, like `Add Repository`, and when you click on it you can choose the type of the repository: local folder or an online repository (like MyGet). 

There should be a way to test if the specified path/link is a repository before adding it.

data.title: Fix PackageManager Error When Attempting to Install Packages That Have Not Been Indexed Yet

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

Just after releasing a new package version, there is a time span of around two to five minutes where the package is available online, but has not yet been indexed by the NuGet gallery. The PackageManager already lists the package as available, but when attempting to install it during this period, it will fail with an exception.
#### How to reproduce
- [Impractical] Release a package update and immediately attempt to install the package in a fresh Duality installation. 
  - Updating is not known to cause the same error, but it can't be ruled out yet either.
#### Workaround
- Just wait a few minutes and try again.
#### Analysis
- Theory: The error happens because the two internal ways of retrieving a package provide different results. 
  - Listing all available packages via `QueryAvailablePackages` includes not-yet-indexed packages.
  - Finding a specific package via `GetRepositoryPackages` does not.
#### Attachments
- Error message:

```
---------------------------
Failed to perform task
---------------------------
An error occurred while performing task 'Package 'AdamsLair.Duality.Plugins.Tilemaps.Sample', Version 1.0.1.0...': 
NullReferenceException: Der Objektverweis wurde nicht auf eine Objektinstanz festgelegt.

CallStack:
   at Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.CreatePackageInfo(IPackage package) in c:\projects\duality\DualityEditor\PackageManagement\PackageManager.cs:Zeile 1009.
   at Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.CheckDeepLicenseAgreements(IPackage package) in c:\projects\duality\DualityEditor\PackageManagement\PackageManager.cs:Zeile 743.
   at Duality.Editor.Plugins.PackageManagerFrontend.PackageViewDialog.<InstallPackage>b__5(PackageOperationData d) in c:\projects\duality\DualityEditorPlugins\PackageManagerFrontend\Modules\PackageViewDialog.cs:Zeile 338.
   at Duality.Editor.Plugins.PackageManagerFrontend.PackageViewDialog.<PackageOperationThread>d__1e.MoveNext() in c:\projects\duality\DualityEditorPlugins\PackageManagerFrontend\Modules\PackageViewDialog.cs:Zeile 758.
---------------------------
OK   
---------------------------
```

data.title: Replace EditorAction "Description" Property With HelpSystem Lookup

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
#### Summary

The abstract `EditorAction` base class requires its implementations to specify a description string. Replace this with help system lookups similar to what the Tilemap- and RigidBodyEditor- tools do.
#### Analysis
- Instead of a description string, provide an optional HelpInfo instance.
- Make sure it's cached and not re-created every call.

This is a tiny pull request with no impact on the actual code itself, just fixes two warnings for two XML documentation comments thrown by Visual Studio.

(First pull request was based off of the wrong branch, this one is correct, hopefully)

data.title: XML documentation warnings fix.
data.body: This is a tiny pull request with no impact on the actual code itself, just fixes two warnings for two XML documentation comments thrown by Visual Studio.

data.title: Update Documentation for the v3.0 Milestone

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
#### Summary

With the overall cleanup and API changes that are scheduled for milestone v3.0, it will be crucial to keep the documentation updated, while at the same time providing the old v2.x docs for anyone who hasn't updated yet or will stick to v2.x for an extended period of time.
#### Analysis
- Basically just go over all Wiki articles and make sure all the code runs and all the code snippets are still correct.
- Double-check the Getting Started guide. For most users, it's the first thing they'll see and try.
- Similar to the main repository, the Wiki will need some kind of a release-cycle based versioning.
  - Clone all the docs into a v3.0 folder and edit articles in there.
  - Edit the Wiki main page to include a link to the v3.0 main page and a notice about the version state.
  - When releasing v3.0, move the old docs into a v2.x subfolder and the new v3.0 docs into the main folder.

data.title: Write a Short Tilemaps Introduction Wiki Article

milestone.title: Tilemaps Plugin v1.0
milestone.description: Implement a rectangular 2D tilemap plugin.

data.body:
#### Summary

A quick "Getting Started with Tilemaps" would be nice. Don't go too much into depth, just the basics for now. 
#### Analysis
- Mention that there is a sample package on Tilemaps.
- Topic to cover:
  - Installing the plugin, assuming a raw Duality installation. For now, add a note saying that the plugin is not released yet and thus only available by manual compilation.
  - Quickstart: Importing the mage city image and setting it up in the Tilemap editor.
    - "Create Tilemap", then dragdrop for a single one first. Explain. Delete.
    - Drag into the Tilemap Editor for setup dialog. Also mention it's available via button. Mention the resize button as well.
  - The difference between flat and deep Tilemaps.
  - Basic Tilemap editing tools.
  - Intermission: Basic custom actor renderer.
    - Introduce with regular SpriteRenderer first, illustrate depth interaction.
    - Provide finished script for a very, very simple ActorRenderer.
    - Provide another script for walking around in the map.
  - Specifying Tileset data (collision, depth).

data.title: Refactor DataConverter API and Internals

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
#### Summary

The current DataConverter API is a mess. It needs to be refactored to reduce boilerplace and simplify user implementations.
#### Analysis
- Provide a clean `IDataConverterEnvironment` interface.
- Do not distinguish between results, available data and child conversions.
- Do distinguish between asking whether data is available and actually handling / using it.
- Move all real-world interaction behind the environment interface.
  - A converter should not determine Resource paths for new results.
  - A converter should not save Resources.
  - Maybe, a converter shouldn't even find matching "existing Resource" candidates.
- Do not keep track of converter path length, because granularity is an implementation detail. Instead, let each converter specify how costly the operation it proposes would be.
- Unify handling an input, specifying an output, suggesting a name for it (and specifying a cost for this path?) in a single call.
  - Also figure out a way to get rid of the boolean return value.
- A convert operation should first perform the entire operation and then decide whether to apply it, and which paths to apply.
  - Some converters do not know whether they're applicable until their child conversions are performed and the results are available.
  - Most converters will still just early-out in `CanConvert`, this would just be for the more ambiguous cases.
- A convert operation should only do an early-out with readily available resources, if that early-out would handle all available data.
  - Keep track of what data is available overall (`GetFormats` + `GetData(format)` in `ConversionData`?)

data.title: Diagonal Tilemap Collision Should Integrate With Filled / Full Collision Tiles

milestone.title: Tilemaps Plugin v1.0
milestone.description: Implement a rectangular 2D tilemap plugin.

data.body:
#### Summary

Diagonal collision does not currently integrate with filled collision, even if a closed extension of a filled area is formed. With regard to rounded collision shape corners, this should change.
#### Attachments

A screenshot illustrating the problem:

![diagonalcollisionissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14859411/16713581/f305cbba-46ac-11e6-8320-77861837f38a.png)

data.title: Implement a Tilemap Setup Menu

milestone.title: Tilemaps Plugin v1.0
milestone.description: Implement a rectangular 2D tilemap plugin.

data.body:
#### Summary

Currently, setting up tilemaps is a tedious task and additionally, new users have no clue how to start. There should be a setup menu that automatically sets up a simple multi-layer tilemap including collision shape generation.
#### Analysis
- The menu can go next to the resize menu.
- There should be a similar context-based auto-popup of the setup menu when the Tilemap editor is focused / opened in a Scene without an existing tilemap.
- Options this menu should offer to users:
  - Number of tilemap layers.
  - Size of the tilemap.
  - Tileset to use, with the option to specify a pixmap instead and auto-create the tileset.
    - Dragdrop should be possible. Topmost, but not modal?
    - In addition, tie in issue #150?
  - Flat or deep tilemap?
  - Generate collision shapes or not?
- Additional improvements related to this:
  - Introduce a "Create Tileset" right-click action for Pixmaps.
  - Provide a DataConverter from Pixmap to Tileset
    - Double-check this and fix potential false-positives for this conversion.
    - As with other converters, implement code paths for re-use of existing Resources.
  - Dragdrop of a Tileset into the Scene Editor could create a GameObject with Tilemap and TilemapRenderer Component.
    - Should be possible using a DataConverter implementation, requiring a CreateObj operation and with GameObject as a target type directly.
  - Dragdrop of a (convertible to) Tileset into the Tilemap Editor should open up the Setup dialog with the Tileset assigned.
    - This would be "hardcoded" as part of the Tilemap Editor, because it doesn't allow other dragdrop operations anyway, nor creating other objects.

data.title: Tile Brush Should Fill Line Area on Fast Cursor Movement

milestone.title: Tilemaps Plugin v1.0
milestone.description: Implement a rectangular 2D tilemap plugin.

data.body:
#### Summary

Right now, the tile brush only fills the currently hovered area when it is moved. However, to allow snappy fast editing, it should actually fill the entire region from the last cursor position to the current one, so no spots in between are left out.
#### Analysis
- This will require a modified (pixel) line fill algorithm.

data.title: Move "Smooth Animation" Into a Sample Project

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
#### Summary

Currently, smooth animation support is all over the core, despite the fact that it will only very rarely actually be used. It's rather specific and complicates a lot of things. There is no reason for it to be tied to the core. To fix this, move smooth animation into a distinct sample project, which will be released as a package.
#### Analysis
- Update AnimSpriteRenderer API so a subclass can introduce smooth animation support for the sample project.
- Remove builtin Default Resources related to smooth animation and re-create the required ones in the sample project.
- Remove smooth animation support from the DynamicLighting plugin entirely.
- Having it in a distinct sample project also has the advantage of being ready for testing at all times.

data.title: Introduce a Proper Mapping From VertexDeclaration to Shader Vertex Attributes

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
#### Summary

Right now, vertex elements are mapped to shader vertex attributes based on a small set of pre-defined roles and using type matching as a fallback. This is not sufficient for custom vertex types that include multiple fields without a predefined role. As a prerequisite of issues #219 and #220, a better way of mapping vertex format fields to shader vertex attributes will be required.
#### Analysis
- Without the fixed function pipeline, shaders need to be able to declare a role for each vertex attribute.
  - This is non-standard, GLSL doesn't support this. Introduce this as a pre-processing step.
  - Parse vertex attribute roles using the same enum that is used on the engine side.
  - Use C# attribute notation? 
    - `[VertexElementRole(Position)] attribute vec3 vertexWorldPos;`
    - Quite verbose. Doesn't fit in well.
  - Use more GLSL-like notation? `
    - `@position attribute vec3 vertexWorldPos;`
    - `attribute vec3 vertexWorldPos : position;`
    - Looks a lot better.
- The current set of vertex element roles is very narrow. Extend this.
  - Introduce a bigger set of roles to choose from.
  - Don't do hardcoded numbering like `Position0`, `Position1`.
- If no role is set, or multiple vertex attributes match the same role, perform name-based comparison to select the best match.

data.title: Rename IPluginLoader to IAssemblyLoader

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
#### Summary

It just expresses what it does more closely.

#### Analysis
- Rename the `IPluginLoader` interface.
- Rename the `DefaultPluginLoader` class.
- Rename the `DualityApp.PluginLoader` property.

data.title: Multiple core plugin project templates

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
You can't use a non portable third party library in your game, because the 'game-core-plugin' is a portable class library.

A workaround for this issue is to modify the project-file of visual studio.
(see: http://stackoverflow.com/a/23135170)

It would be nice if you could select the type of the core plugin (portable or not), when you are creating a new duality-project.
(Maybe a dropdown-control? Checkbox?)

data.title: Provide More Thorough System / Environment Logs at Startup

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

As mentioned in issue #287, there are problems that could be a lot easier to trace if every Duality initialization would automatically log a lot more diagnostic information regarding the system and runtime environment, as well as command line arguments and environment variables.
#### Analysis
- Move all PCL-available info logs from the system backend plugin to the actual DualityApp initialization. There are cases where plugins can't be loaded!
- Provide additional logs in the `DefaultPluginLoader` implementation.
- Other things to log:
  - CLR Version, 64 bit / 32 bit (Process & Environment)
  - Processor Count
  - Environment.CurrentDirectory
  - Command line arguments
  - Environment Variables
  - ...?

data.title: Font.GlyphData Overhaul, Proper Kerning Pairs

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
#### Summary

The `Font` Resource is a very old class with some bad design choices. `GlyphData` is lacking and kerning is done using a custom algorithm rather than using imported kerning pair information.
#### Analysis
- As a requirement, complete issue #324 first.
- Move `GlyphData` out of `Font` and call it `FontGlyphData`.
- Move `RenderMode` out of `Font` and call it `FontRenderMode`.
- Replace `Width` and `Height` int values with one `Vector2 Size`.
- Replace `OffsetX` and `OffsetY` int values with one `Vector2 Offset`.
- Introduce a `float Advance` value that will determine how far the cursor will advance after this glyph, rather than using some internal calculations. The `MonoSpace` property will then become purely FYI.
- Remove `KerningSamplesLeft` and `KerningSamplesRight` entirely and replace the kerning algorithm with an optionally provided set of kerning-pair-to-added-advance mappings that is maintained at the `Font` level.
- Update embedded default Fonts according to the above changes.

data.title: Consider Turning ContentProvider Into a Non-Static Class

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
#### Summary

As part of the general maintainability and testability push with Duality, one of the goals is reducing the amount of static API and extracting self-contained instance classes where possible. `ContentProvider` would be an excellent candidate for this.
#### Analysis
- Make `ContentProvider` a non-static class and introduce `IDisposable` API to allow for content cleanups.
- Since static access is still required, have a singleton-like instance in a static `DualityApp` field.
- The new API would likely be something like `DualityApp.Content.Request(xy)`, which isn't much less convenient than before and even comes with some user-side advantages such as extension method support.

data.title: Track Down Broken Picking Bug in Game Jam Project

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

[This game jam project](https://github.com/ilexp/bmj2016-06) managed to break in-editor picking operations completely. It is yet unclear how exactly it did that, but this needs to be tracked down.
#### How to reproduce
1. Check out the game jam project.
2. Revert [this commit](https://github.com/ilexp/bmj2016-06/commit/a1869335dc7cb35619d4336e8c5fd7d81dd1d6a2#diff-f4478f73416db39395271011e21ded5a) on the file `HudRenderer.cs` specifically, without touching any other files. These changes fix the behavior.
3. Open the editor and set it up in a way that there are two CamViews visible at the same time. One is set to `Scene Editor`, the other is set to `Game View`.
4. Start the game in sandbox mode.
5. Stop the game.
6. Picking is now broken, permanently. It is still performed, but yields wrong results.
   - Reports object ids that appear to have not been rendered at all.
   - Constantly spams "Unexpected Picking result" logs.
   - Sometimes even spawns `ArgumentOutOfRangeException`, probably due to accessing out of bounds data based on invalid "picked" object ids.
#### Workaround
- The above linked commit fixes this issue by adjusting the `HudRenderer` Component implementation. It is unknown why exactly this works.

data.title: Shorten Type Names in Grouped PropertyEditors

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

In the current version, memberwise-, list-, and potentially other grouped PropertyEditors display the full type name in the value area of the group. This reduces readability and should be considered for a change.
#### Analysis
- Prefer a types name over its full name for readability reasons.
- It is likely that in most cases, the full type name is returned from non-overridden `ToString` methods. This case would need to be detected and circumvented with a custom type name based `ToString` fallback.
- In other cases (list, potentially?), the implementation can be changed easily.

data.title: Add Element Insertion, Re-Ordering and Removal to PropertyGrid IList Editor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

The current implementation of the PropertyGrid IList editor does not allow to re-order to remove elements. This can get quite annoying and cumbersome in cases where element order matters and an element has to be inserted at some point. It should be possible to...
1. ...insert a new element at index N.
2. ...take an element from index N and insert it at index M.
3. ...remove an element at index N.
#### Analysis
- This could be solved by introducing left side "element handles" that allow drag-drop operations.
- Movement is solved by drag-drop.
- Removal is solved by introducing a removal button on the handle.
  - Make sure to remove all now redundant delete button usages for this purpose.
- Insetion is solved by introducing an insertion button on the handle.

data.title: Fix Potential Duplicate Resource Loads on Ambiguous Paths

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
#### Summary

When requesting the same Resource with two path strings that are unequal, but do point to the same location, the Resource lookup fails once for each ambiguous string, causing the system to load the same Resource N times in the worst case.
#### Analysis
- Example: `Data\SomeRes.Texture.res` vs `Data/SomeRes.Texture.res`.
- This is only a problem when Resource paths are entered manually, as the system provides Resource paths following a fixed scheme.
- It can lead to users stumbling badly over Resources apparently showing inconsistent data and seemingly failing to hot-reload Resources in the editor.
- One way to fix this would be to let the `ContentProvider` transform request paths into a normalized shape.
  - This has potential negative performance implications on lots of lookups. Probably not that crucial, but be aware of it.
  - This needs to be very careful, since custom Resource resolvers could use arbitrary strings and expect them to be unaltered.

data.title: Camera View Visibility Mask Setting

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

There is currently no way to adjust the `VisibilityMask` of the Camera View's internal camera. This would be helpful in multi-pass rendering setups, where different object visibility groups are usually rendered to different targets, but clutter up the Camera View with the default render pass setup.
#### Analysis
- This will require another control in the Camera View toolbar.
- Potentially a ComboBox with a custom flags dropdown, similar to the one in the actual property editor.

data.title: Provide Proper Error Messages When Using Multi-Dimensional Arrays

data.title: Release Binary Tilemaps Packages

milestone.title: Tilemaps Plugin v1.0
milestone.description: Implement a rectangular 2D tilemap plugin.

data.body:
#### Summary

After the merge of issue #335 has been performed, do a first binary release of the tilemaps plugin packages.
#### Analysis
- New Packages: Tilemaps.Core, Tilemaps.Editor, Tilemaps.Sample
- Will require `.nuspec` files and proper package icons.
- Double-check the dependency situation.
- Test released packages if all works as expected.

data.title: Merge Tilemaps into Master Branch

milestone.title: Tilemaps Plugin v1.0
milestone.description: Implement a rectangular 2D tilemap plugin.

data.body:
#### Summary

With the tilemaps plugin slowly nearing its conclusion, a merge into the master branch is imminent. As a prerequisite, all content-side development issues of the [Tilemaps Plugin v1.0](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/milestones/Tilemaps%20Plugin%20v1.0) milestone need to be successfully dealt with. Optional post-release additions to the tilemaps plugin have already been moved out of this milestone.
#### Analysis
- After merging into master but before release, there should be a testing session with the community to iron out all the rough edges.
- The overall API should be considered stable.
- Documentation should have reached a sufficient state.
- The process of setting up a tilemaps environment from scratch should be as user-friendly as possible.

data.title: Moving objects with Mouse button won't work properly
